name: Ashley, Wm. Whitley
employer: Law Offices of Wm. Whitley Ashley
title: Attorney / Sole Practitioner
notes: Licensed California attorney in San Rafael, CA with 36+ years experience in real estate, medical malpractice, wrongful death, wills & probate, and personal injury litigation. State Bar of California #141144.

name: Ballachey, John Maturin
title: Insurance Agent / Owner
notes: Insurance agent based in Healdsburg, CA (Sonoma County). Operates The Ballachey Agency.

name: Cropper, David P.
title: Principal
ngos: Urban Land Institute San Francisco (District Council Vice Chair; former Chair of Sustainable Development Council; longtime Executive Board member); Peninsula Habitat for Humanity (former Board Member and Chair); Peninsula Health Care District (former Board Member and Chair); NAIOP Silicon Valley Chapter (past Board Member)
notes: Veteran Bay Area commercial real estate developer with 38+ years of experience. Previously Managing Director at TMG Partners for 22 years. Began career in commercial real estate finance at Union Bank and Comerica Bank. Led development of The Crossing at San Bruno ($250M mixed-use project) and other major SF Bay Area projects. AB from Occidental College.

name: Damon, Allen F.
title: CEO
ngos: Western Rivers Conservancy (Board of Directors, since January 2021)
notes: Previously held senior wealth management positions at Goldman Sachs and UBS Financial Services Inc. in San Francisco for several decades (UBS office at 555 California Street). Currently CEO of D4 Capital.

name: Dressel, Chris J.
title: Real Estate Investments
notes: Former NFL tight end (1983-1991) who played for the Houston Oilers, San Francisco 49ers, Kansas City Chiefs, and New York Jets after being drafted in the 3rd round of the 1983 NFL Draft out of Stanford University. After retiring from professional football, pursued a real estate career in San Francisco, joining family in a company operating residential and rental properties.

name: Enright, Brady Lee
title: Partner and Equity Portfolio Manager
notes: 34 years of investment industry experience, 28 years at Capital Group. Based in San Francisco. Holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BA in Biology from Stanford University. Holds CFA designation. Previously an equity research analyst at Provident Investment Counsel before joining Capital Group.

name: Filippenko, Alexei V.
title: Distinguished Professor of Astronomy; Richard and Rhoda Goldman Distinguished Professor in the Physical Sciences; Class of 1954 Chair
ngos: Astronomical Society of the Pacific (former Board President, 2001-2003); American Academy of Arts and Sciences (elected member, 2015); National Academy of Sciences (elected member, 2009); American Astronomical Society (elected Fellow, 2021)
notes: One of the world's most highly cited astronomers. Member of both teams that discovered the accelerating expansion of the universe in 1998, a discovery honored with the 2011 Nobel Prize in Physics (awarded to the teams' leaders). Has co-authored more than 1,200 research papers. Also received a share of the Gruber Cosmology Prize (2007) and the Breakthrough Prize in Fundamental Physics (2015). Voted 'Best Professor' at UC Berkeley a record 9 times. Named Carnegie/CASE National Professor of the Year in 2006. Has produced five astronomy video courses with The Great Courses and appeared in more than 100 television documentaries.

name: Fotre, Terry Vincent
title: Emergency Medicine Physician
notes: Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine (DO) specializing in emergency medicine, practicing in Stanford/Palo Alto, CA. Graduated from Chicago College of Osteopathic Medicine at Midwestern University. Affiliated with Stanford Health Care. NPI #1417987421.

name: Frye, Lawrence J.
title: CEO and Co-Founder
ngos: Menlo School (former Chairman, 2013-2016); Cancer Commons (former Consultant, 2014-2016); Stanford Medicine Catalyst (Consultant)
notes: Based in Woodside, CA. Holds a BS in Mechanical Engineering and an MBA in Finance and Strategy, both from Stanford University. Career history includes Managing Director at Russell Reynolds Associates (2006-2008), Partner at The Entrepreneurs' Funds (2002-2006), and CEO at @theMoment, Inc. (1999-2001). Life Analytics is developing a platform for more frequent and accurate patient monitoring in clinical trials.

name: Hazlehurst, Thomas B.
title: Founder and Managing Partner
notes: Private equity investor based in Austin, TX. Founded Laird Group Partners, LP (registered at 108 Wild Basin Rd. S, Ste 250, Austin, TX). Previously Director at FPR Partners and prior to that a financial analyst in the investment banking group of Credit Suisse. Holds an AB in Politics from Princeton University.

name: Levingston, Bruce
title: Chancellor's Honors College Artist-in-Residence; Holder of the Lester Glenn Fant Chair
ngos: Premiere Commission, Inc. (Founder and Artistic Director, est. 2001)
notes: Acclaimed American concert pianist based in Oxford, MS and New York City. Founded Premiere Commission in 2001, a nonprofit that has commissioned and premiered over 50 new works by contemporary composers including Philip Glass. The New Yorker called him the 'essential New York pianist.' Has performed at Carnegie Hall, Lincoln Center, and the Royal Opera House at Covent Garden. Received the Governor's Award for Excellence in the Arts (2006) and inducted into the Mississippi Musicians Hall of Fame (2017). Mississippi Governor proclaimed April 9 'Bruce Levingston Day' in 2018. BA with honors in Humanities from University of Texas at Austin.

name: O'Donnell, Chris
title: Actor (Captain Don Hart)
notes: American actor born June 26, 1970 in Winnetka, Illinois. Best known for 14 seasons as G. Callen on NCIS: Los Angeles (CBS, 2009-2023). Currently starring as Captain Don Hart in 9-1-1: Nashville (ABC, premiered October 2025). Film credits include Scent of a Woman (1992), Batman Forever (1995), and Batman & Robin (1997). BS in Marketing from Boston College (1992). Board member of REDF, a San Francisco-based nonprofit that creates jobs for people facing barriers to employment. Graduated from Loyola Academy (1988).

name: Pattee, Gordon Burleigh
title: President and CEO
political_donations: Active donor to Republican and bipartisan causes; shared donation patterns with donors to Joe Biden, Kirsten Gillibrand, Lindsey Graham, Barack Obama, George W. Bush, and Rudy Giuliani per LittleSis FEC records. Vice Chairman of the New York State Republican Family Committee.
ngos: New York City Ballet (Board of Directors since 1989; former President); New York-Presbyterian Hospital (Trustee since 1988); New York History Society (former Vice Chairman); Citizens Committee for New York City (Board since 1990); National Victim Center (former Vice Chairman); The Chapin School (former Vice Chairman)
notes: Born April 13, 1948 in San Francisco, CA. Founded MAP Capital Corp in New York City in 1987, a money management firm. Career included positions at Bank of California (1971-1973), White Weld & Company, Lehman Brothers Kuhn Loeb (1975-1981), A.G. Becker (1981-1984), and Merrill Lynch Capital Markets (1984-1987). BA in Economics from Stanford University (1970); MBA from Harvard University (1975). Vice Chairman of the New York State Republican Family Committee.

name: Stuart, Alexander D.
title: President
political_donations: Heavy Republican donor. Contributions to Republican National Committee ($266,200 across 12 donations, 2000-2016); Illinois Republican Party ($82,000 across 13 donations, 2004-2015); National Republican Congressional Committee ($54,800, 2009-2015); National Republican Senatorial Committee ($35,500, September 2020); McConnell Victory Committee ($25,000, April 2019); Right to Rise USA/Jeb Bush super PAC ($94,145, 2015-2016); Restore Our Future PAC/Mitt Romney ($25,000, 2012); Mark Kirk (Illinois) ($31,600, 1999-2013); Dan Sullivan (Alaska) ($35,500, 2020). Gave more than $1.5 million total to Republican candidates and conservative super PACs.
ngos: Lake Forest College (Board of Trustees); Securing America's Future Energy (Board Member); Black Stone Minerals LP (Independent Director); Northwestern Lake Forest Hospital (Board Member); St. Andrew's School (Board Member); Illinois Teachers' Retirement System (former Board Member, appointed by Gov. Rauner)
notes: Fourth-generation scion of the family that founded Quaker Oats Company. Son of Robert D. Stuart Jr., former chairman and CEO of Quaker Oats (1966-1981) and U.S. Ambassador to Norway under President Reagan. Manages family fortune through North Star Investments in Lake Forest, IL. Long-time partner and board member of Black Stone Minerals LP, an independent oil and gas minerals company. Former finance chairman of the Illinois Republican Party. Gave more than $150,000 to Gov. Bruce Rauner's 2014 campaign.

name: Sullivan, Walter H. III
employer: Walter H. Sullivan III Real Estate
title: Real Estate Broker
notes: Licensed California Real Estate Broker (license #00514657, issued April 28, 2016) based at 2258 Pacific Avenue, San Francisco, CA 94115. Great-grandson of Georges and Fernande de Latour, founders of Beaulieu Vineyard in Napa Valley. Family company established 1985.
